title: For Sale:  Survival/Sustainability Kit
postcontent:
Survival/Sustainability Kit
300+ pieces 
Archers designs products for people.  We have researched current survival/bug-out kits widely available and found them to be dangerously lacking in sustainability tools and equipment.  Everything contained in our kits are multi-purpose and provide the basics for sustaining life indefinitely.  Our kits include food, shelter, cooking, hunting, fishing, water filtration, along with a well-stocked bug-out kit.
Two person kit contains:
Bug-out kit
250 piece personal care kit with first aid pain relievers, anti-diarrhea medicines, etc. 
A Week’s worth of pre-packaged, dehydrated, canned food.
Cook set coal oven/stove low smoke, nine piece mess cooking kit, and pit grill.
Water purification:
Activated carbon sand filter, gravity flow/pump, contains enough refills to last years.
12 piece multi-function pump. Pumps water, inflates tires, air mattresses. 
Fresh and collection water jugs, coffee filters.
Hunting/Fishing Supplies:
Dock demon fishing pole
20 piece tackle box with hooks, weights, and bobbers. 
2 traps 1 modified rat trap, easily traps small game 1 classic rabbit snare.
Tools:
Shovel with pick, hack saw blade, duct tape, gloves, magnesium fire starter.
Stainless steel survival knife with saw back and mini survival kit with compass.
15-in-1 stainless steel multi-tool with carrying case, led flashlight with batteries.
Shelter:
 14X6 and 7X9 camo outdoor tarps create a variety of shelters and many other uses.
8 piece tent spikes, 50 foot poly rope, and package of assorted bungee cords.
Things that you need to add: edible plants book native to your area, detailed map, sleeping bags suitable for your region, a 22 rifle, can be purchased for about $200.  Ammo is roughly $20 for 500 rounds.  You should also include a survival manual.  There are many good ones but most are region specific.  
Customer feedback has enhanced this kit and it has made this our most popular product ever!  We invite you to take this camp-site-in-a-box out for a weekend and let us know what you think.  Over the last few years 20+ items have been added or modified due to customer feedback and the price has not increased.  We hope this kit is used for years of fun and never a moment of desperation.
Thank you for your business,

This price includes shipping anywhere in the continental United States.  For areas outside of the US please contact for shipping prices.

title: For Sale:  1890 Gew 88 Danzig 8MM
postcontent:
Do not want to sell this beautiful rifle but, got a damn speeding ticket.  It has been called the 1890 Commission rifle.  It is a GEW 88 which was made in Germany and then it went to their Ally Turkey which it has Turkish markings.  It was made to fire the M88 round but, then in 1905 as all GEWS it was modified to fire the new 7.92x57mm or what we know as the 8MM here in the US.  This is a rare bird due to the condition and it being made with brass.  Bore is clean and bright, has sling as well.  Shoots very well.  Not happy...about this but s#@t happens

title: For Sale:  KIMBER SIS Custom/RL  45 ACP
postcontent:
This is the full size Kimber 45 in the SIS configuration with the built-in accessory rail.  I've hung the little Crimson Trace RailMaster laser on it for fun, but I'll hang on to it if you're not thrilled with it.

Like all SIS's this one is made of stainless steel covered with Kimber's KimPro finish.  The railed frame is checkered and the slide is machined in the SIS style with an ambidexterous safety.  It has the SIS special night sights so you can always see your gun sights.  It will come with the Kimber case and two stainless steel 8 rnd magazines (a Kimber KimPro Tac-Mag and a Mec-Gar tactical mag).

The SIS has everything the Kimber Warrior configuration has (except lanyard loop) and more, being stainless steel.

This gun functions flawlessly, but it is not as pretty as a brand new one.  The KimPro finish has taken a few scratches (not through to the stainless steel, but not easy to buff out either) and the fancy SIS wood grips are a little beat up.  It is a great shooter, but not necessarily one for your pristine SIS collection.  

The extra weight of the rail makes this a very easy to steady weapon, so the red laser dot stays where you put it [this in contrast to my little Ultra Carry whose laser dot dances all over the target].

If this ad is up, the gun is available. No trades thanks, and please let's not start negotiating the price until you see the gun.

This firearm comes with 40rd mag, 2 30rd mags, 350rds of ammo, and scope with authentic Russian arsenal posp mount.  Bipod is a Romanian mil-spec. I am in no hurry to part with, the AK's AR15 and SKS's slowly keep creeping up in value. I still remember during the Clinton years of walking into Bradis Guns and hand selecting a nice Chinese SKS for 69.95 back in 96. They have never went back to that level!
Please call, email or text to REDACTED anytime!

title: For Sale:  Operative B
postcontent: Go to the fridge and grab a can of soda.  Stand in a quiet room and open it.  That’s what the Operative B sounds like firing CCI Minimag!  With the Operative B, we have truly created an integrally suppressed bolt-action .22 rifle unlike any other.  The suppressor core and tube are fully removable for cleaning, and the barrel is conservatively ported to keep inexpensive bulk pack high-velocity ammunition subsonic. (~1030fps with CCI Minimag)  The barrel inside the suppressor tube is a full 16.5” and the overall length of the gun is identical to a factory MkII.  We designed and manufacture this rifle for the suppressor enthusiast who demands the quietest possible package, and the Operative B is the quietest suppressed firearm that we know of.

title: For Sale:  BEST tactical shotgun on here, priced to move, with ammo and extras!
postcontent:
The Remington 1100 Tactical 2 is, arguably, one of the finest combat shotguns ever made. I researched it thoroughly before purchasing this. It is more reliable than a Saiga and more durable than a Mossberg. Short 18" barrel with a 6+1 capacity, and you can reload between shots without needing to change magazines. Being gas-operated with a steel receiver it is one of the lightest recoiling 12 gauge shotguns ever made, and it blows fist sized holes in things as fast as you can pull the trigger. This is a very well thought out design.

The prior owner purchased it new and had some custom work done to it to make it even better:
*Mesa Tactical Urbano stock with adjustable cheek riser and Limbsaver recoil pad.
*Mesa Tactical 6-round side saddle with Picatinny rail if you want to mount an optic.
*Nordic Components charging handle.
*Nordic Components mag clamp (a mini-rail can be ordered for $17 to mount a flashlight on said clamp).
*Oversized safety installed by Bowers Tactical, who also polished the bolt release.
*Condor Tactical shotgun scabbard with gear pouch.
*Assorted small parts & cleaning kit.
*Manual & warranty card.

VERY LOW ROUND COUNT from the prior owner, mostly Federal birdshot, approximately 300 rds.  I've only owned this shotgun for a few weeks and have not fired it. This is an outstanding shotgun, but just not the right choice for me. Due to an injury I have difficulty handling an 8 pound assault weapon without a sling.

I was going to order the mini-tac rail for the mag clamp (part # TRL-BCT-150) to mount a flashlight and a Tru-Glo fiberoptic front sight, but never got around to it. I highly recommend these items to the new owner. A red dot or holographic sight can be mounted on the top rail, or you can remove it and mount ghost rings. Many possible options.

I did, however, purchase a lot of buckshot: 6 unopened boxes of Winchester #1 Buck, 6 unopened boxes of Winchester Mil-Spec 00 Buck, and a pair of A-Zoom snap caps. That is 60 rounds of the BEST buckshot available, plus a pair of training rounds to practice reloads and dry fire.

Manufacturer: Remington
Model #: 1100 Tactical 2
Type: Shotgun
Finish: Blasted Black Oxide
Sights: Ft: Bead
Barrel Length: 18"
Overall Length: 42.5"
Weight: 7.75 lbs
Caliber: 12 Gauge
Capacity: 6+1
Action: Semi-Automatic
# of Mags: 2 Shot Extention
Chokes: Improved Cylinder
Receiver: Drilled & Tapped
Chamber: 2.75"
Features: Sling Swivel Studs

This shotgun is practically new and has nearly $500 in extras.

Asking only $775 CASH.

Not really looking for trades.  If you have a quality compact AR in 5.56 or 9mm that would work, as would a S&W 10mm.  Would also consider a hammerless alloy .38 + cash.

Colorado sale only. Will not ship. Will not travel too far beyond greater Denver area. No bill of sale required, but must be a legal CO resident and not a dirtbag.

Thanks.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Wesson & Harrington .38-55 WCF Target Rifle
postcontent:
Wesson & Harrington .38-55 WCF Target Rifle. Excellent condition. $375 CASH. Open To Trade Offers. Call REDACTED.

Model CR3855 - Target Model Rifle Specifications

• Action - Color case hardened, break open, side lever release. • Safety Mechanism - Patented transfer bar system. • Barrel - 28" • Sights - None, dovetail front, barrel drilled and tapped rear. • Length of Pull - 14" Drop at Comb - 1-3/4" Drop at Heel - 2-5/8" • Weight - 7-1/2 lbs. • Overall Length - 42" • Stock - Hand checkered, American Black Walnut with case colored, crescent steel buttplate. • Forend - Hand checkered, American Black Walnut. • Ammunition - 38-55 Win.

Beginning in 1871, two members of a family, which would establish a firearms dynasty, cooperated on the design for a series of revolvers destined to change the firearms industry and create what would become "America's Gunsmith".

Frank Wesson was well known for his hinged breech and falling block rifles. In Fact, his hinged breech carbine was actually accepted for use as an official secondary arm during the Civil War. His nephew, Gilbert Harrington, was a bright young firearms designer, and was granted a patent for a new mechanism to eject spent cases from revolvers. Together in 1871, they began a company called Wesson & Harrington in Worcester, Massachusetts. This company would continue until 1875 when Frank Wesson sold his interest to William Richardson, creating the Harrington & Richardson Arms Company, one of the most prolific manufacturers of firearms ever to operate in America. The Wesson & Harrington rifles and shotguns of today celebrate this fine tradition in this historic region of firearms manufacture.

Tradition, history and American craftsmanship blend to build today's Wesson & Harrington rifles. Frank Wesson & Gilbert Harrington began their enterprise in 1871 and we continue their proud tradition today, building fine long range rifles in the same Massachusetts county over a century and quarter later.

The Wesson & Harrington 45-70 Government Buffalo Classic and the 38-55 WCF Target Model are true American classics to their very core. Modeled after the Frank Wesson tip-up rifles which were first made in Worcester, Massachusetts in the 1850's, these modern classic fill the need of the long range cowboy action shooter as well as those who just enjoy shooting these great old cartridges.

Both the Buffalo Classic and the Target Model reflect true 19th century styling, including real color case hardening on the frame and crescent butt plate, plus "one line at a time", hand cut checkering on their American black walnut stocks and forends. No sights are provided on the high polish blue barrels but a dovetail slot for a post or globe style front sight like the Lyman #17 is cut at the muzzle end of the barrel. The area over the chamber is drilled and tapped to accept a peep sight such as the Williams WGRSHR. As these rifles are designed for competition shooting, a number of sight options are available from a wide variety of specialty suppliers. The shooter's taste and style of competition will dictate the appropriate style of sights.

The Buffalo Classic in 45-70 Government has carved out a very competitive position in today's fast growing sport of Cowboy Action Shooting and BPCR shooting. It features a mid weight 32" barrel to get all the velocity possible out of the venerable 45-70 Government cartridge. The 32" barrel length also provides the necessary sighting radius for long range matches.

The Wesson & Harrington Target Model in 38-55 WCF follows the tradition of fine target offerings from the likes of Ballard or Wurfflein in the 1870's. The 38-55 Cartridge traces its roots to the early 1880's when it was developed for target shooting by the Ballard Rifle Company. The Wesson & Harrington Target Model uses a 28" heavy target barrel and original style rifling for consistent accuracy. This barrel length was one of the most popular for this caliber when it was introduced. The Target model also includes all steel furniture. A high polish, heat treated steel trigger guard and forend spacer are standard on this rifle and are now available as a factory upgrade to the owners of the Buffalo Classic, through the H&R 1871, Inc, Customer Service Department.

Both Wesson & Harrington rifles feature a level of quality and attention to detail which would have made the original Wesson & Harrington proud to have their names affixed to the action.

Wesson & Harrington .38-55 WCF Target Rifle. Excellent condition. $350 CASH. Open To Trade Offers. Call REDACTED.

postcontent:
The Essence of Liberty is a rimfire suppressor designed from the ground up 
with every possible feature that is desirable in a rimfire suppressor. It is 
lightweight, being made with over 95% titanium in its construction, this 
suppressor virtually disappears on the end of your weapon system.  We utilize 
a stainless steel replaceable blast baffle that will allow the suppressor to last 
several lifetimes with virtually no wear on the critical parts.  It has world 
class sound reduction on BOTH a pistol AND a rifle.  It has reduced blow back 
due to the high efficient baffle design that redirects high velocity gasses into 
the suppressor and not back into the gun. It comes apart for cleaning with 
minimal effort.  The tube is not threaded, but rather the endcap threads 
directly into the core,  nor is the tube exposed to the blast energy at the 
muzzle. It has a tapered bore to allow for slight variations in alignment.
